data:
Top William McElgin Instructor Ph.D., 2007 - University of Chicago 275 Nicholson Hall, Tower Dr. 225-578-6912-Office mcelgin@lsu.edu Physics Education Group The Physics Education Group is involved in the development and implementation of programs
                  to improve the teaching and learning of physics at all levels. Our group includes
                  faculty whose expertise is in the area of physics education, as well as research faculty
                  who voluntarily make contributions to this important area. We often collaborate with
                  science education faculty from the LSU College of Education, and with faculty from
                  other colleges and universities throughout the state and nation. In fact, most of
                  our programs are either statewide or national in scope. Our activities include cognitive
                  research to better understand how students learn physics concepts, design of new courses
                  and curricula, development of associated curriculum materials and resources, exploring
                  innovative educational uses for new technologies, and special enhancement programs
                  for practicing teachers and precollege students. Telephone: 225-578-2261 Fax: 225-578-5855
